comments.body: This is a great Idea!!!!!!

Considering the population of most villages is rather low and what historical population geography data seem to indicate, 1 in 20-30 villages should have a chance of being a city as that would make more sense. There should also be villages with sizes in between or in other words towns.
Yes and the Villagers would trade better and there would be more chests. There would be multiple golems
Ok

I'm not sure I understand the point of this or why it would be desirable to add this to the game. If nothing else, it doesn't really make sense for there to be one-way portals, and it really doesn't make sense to add nether and end portals that just randomly spawn.

Great idea, but the chances of one spawning has to be incredibly low, right? As in 1 in every 3,000,000 chunks, and I'm not exaggerating, because with the end one you could literally not even have to fight through the stronghold and just waltz in. Were you thinking of it as a biome that is like the end/nether, but not literally a portal there? If so then it could be less, like 1 in every 500,000 chunks. Either way is has to be ridiculously rare.

Lets be completely real. This idea is great on paper. But, think about it. If you were to come across a rift for either of these places, your just going to be able to skip a HUGE part of the game. Think about it. It wouldn't be so bad for the Nether, as players can just build the portals and go in and out at will, but the End one is the one I have the most problems with. If a player were to come across an End rift,they could just skip huge and major parts of the game. The End is a end-game area. It's designed to be tough and you NEED to have good armor to survive. If a player who has just started up a world comes across one of these, they won't just be able to get into the end way quicker than players should. They will be completely destroyed by the Ender Dragon because of how tough he is. If this idea was to be anywhere near balanced enough, these rifts would have to be EXTREMELY rare. The Nether one wouldn't have to be as rare, as people can get there quite easily with a bit of luck, but an End rift would have to be much harder to find, as players could just skip past most of the game.

I actually don't think that this is a terrible idea. maybe something other than a new mob, but a variant of the desert temple with better loot. Other than Bastions and fortresses, the nether is still lacking in structures, not even mentioning the end.

bad: if there would be this boss it would take a very large space ... additionally adding a new boss is to be avoided because the boss must be less powerful than the final boss, the end dragon.

In response to Samuel Bouchard, I don't see why the structure being big would be a bad thing. I also don't think that all boss fights need to be easier than the dragon since A: The wither can definitely be considered harder than the dragon and B: Minecraft has no ending and needs more adventure and action content for the late game stage. I do think piglin brutes are definitely a step in the right direction but I think many players would enjoy having more

This sounds so cool! I would totally love an air temple-style building in the end!!! I love Avatar and have watched both ATLA and Legend of Korra, so I would love something like that added to Minecraft!

I agree. Here's what I think it should be:

Spruce wood in Taiga, Tundra, Mountain, and variants

Jungle wood in Jungle, Desert (mostly because desert villages use jungle wood), and variants

Acacia wood in Savanna and variants

Dark oak wood in Badlands, Dark Forest, and variants

Oak wood everywhere else

I didn't include birch wood 'cause that's not a very good building material IRL.
@Coinkid12 Well I guess Birch Wood can be used in Birch Forests

Verdict: Wow. I have voted. Best idea I've ever seen on here. Love the image.
I have to say, this looks really cool, I like the concept, is unique, and uses an underused part of the Nether. One of the best structures I've seen.

Well, current mine generation is kind of broken, so just a few tweaks in the way they spawn and generate would be interesting, and quite honestly, I can't see how they wouldn't do that. With new cave gen, not only current mineshaft spawn will break completly, there's probably gonna be major change... Also, there's room for lots of room for new features, and would be shamefull if nothing is changed, as this is the cave (and cliffs) update.

 

 

Also, the entrance is interesting, the "landmarks" stuff makes me feel like there should be an entrance to mineshafts, which would lead you into a maze of corridors (this would also help with the "first night feel" they want to bring back... That's the entire point of them, to start with, and the broken generation doesn't help...), maybe at the foot of a hill and biome based? But that's too much especulation...

Maybe these would only occur in Nether fortresses generating in Warped Forests. This would certainly be thematically consistent.

Have Warped Wart in Soul sand Valley and Warped Forests.

Have Crimson Wart in Crimson Forest and Nether Wastes.

Basalt doesn't have any wart items.

Advantages: is that it keeps the two nether fortresses balanced. Retains the original nether feel where crimson wart originated.

Disadvantages: it may make the two biomes(Crimson Forest and Warped Forest) more challenging. Fortresses are made easier to find.

 

Have Crimson Wart in only the Basalt Delta

Have Warped Wart in only the Soul Sand Valley

Advantage: keeps the Crimson and Warped Forests Challenges the same. Fortresses are limited to only two loot biomes.

Disadvantages: Fortresses are now limited to two nether biomes only for wart loot. Nether wastes no longer has Crimson wart items.
no comments? darn

Since the Ballista is bigger than the bow, the recipe should be logs instead of sticks, iron instead of flint, and no feathers, because it would be pointless; stabilizing a projectile at that magnitude just wouldn't work.
@trojanhorse69 yeah the crafting recipe can be changed. As long as it's expensive enough to balance the weapon.
That‚Äôs way way way to OP

Perhaps the ballista could be craftable, but incredibly expensive (iron block expensive) and requires multiple segments: base (iron), pedestal (log) (this is the tipi part of the ballista), Arm and ladder (logs +iron+others) (this is the main part, where the bolts are fired from), and the frame (iron, crossbow, etc). All four of these parts could then be crafted together to get a finished ballista. Why is it in parts? Each part could have variants that affect the finished ballista. EX: the base. A wood base might not hold as well as an iron base. A stationary pedestal isn‚Äôt able to move, but one that spins could. The frame of the ballista could be modified to include more power, or special effects, such as, holding a torch to light arrows. Great idea!!

I wouldn't even nerf the accuracy, I would set it so you have to leave the ballista, and manually load it, or have a second player be the loader. A better and more logical nerf is to have a fixed rotation speed in order to really feel like a Ballista. The damage could be higher to make it more an anti-tank role to deal with mobs like ravagers, iron golems, withers, and the ender dragon easier. With the given drawback that a ballista is a stationary target with little to no cover. If more nerfs were necessary, have a fixed rotation radius or simply make the recipe more expensive. This could be done by requiring the players to craft multiple parts to put together

I would like it if the mineshafts had a center point, like a moderately sized shaft that uses scaffolding or spiral rails with different levels(floors) where the corridors begin instead of a single dirt room "entrance". Maybe that can easily be extended upward towards an entrance(possibly collapsed).

Also, maybe you can even long corridors where the roof is deliberately filled with big gravel patches, so you have to be careful where you mine, else the roof collapses.

Now that they have increased the world depth I feels important to have ways to get out of caves so having an entrance/exit tunnel for mineshafts reduces the chance you get stuck in a cave and have to mine up 100 blocks to escape.
it would be amazing if there were some miners' skulls scattered around the mine, and also a mine cart with a lantern, and also a little more spacious mines and with more items.

I feel like this structure is missing something, like maybe a new mob like a specter or a new fish-like creature, but I don't know. Let me know what you think about the idea.
Do you have any concept art? Also maybe it should just be a redstone lamp instead of a new block.

No concept art because I feel like whatever design Mojang would do for it would be better than anything I could come up with(I'm not great at design). Also, I feel like a new block would be what sets this structure apart from all the others and I feel like this new block would have many interesting uses. But if this block didn't seem like a good fit for the game or if Mojang believes that it shouldn't be added to Minecraft, a redstone lamp would probably be the best alternative.
